page.title: 19PET SURVEY IN WOOTTON
page.content: We did a pet survey in Norman Way Wootton. We found that the most common pets are dogs, with 16 in 32 houses. There were 7 cats, 2 rabbits and a budgie.We found that mainly old age pensioners live in this road and that they bought these animals for companionship.They also have dogs so that they can take them out for walks and so the people get regular exercise.We also found that in houses where there were rabbits there were also children who took a special interest in their animals and looked after them e.g. feeding and cleaning out cages.
